column1: provides an invaluable starting point.10 In introducing the topic, Gordon
provides the following resume of the procedure’s history:11

column2: Judges have been given to asserting that a stated case, i.e one stated
by  a  magistrate  or  magistrates,  is  a  purely  statutory  remedy.  That
statement seems to be seriously misleading. It is true that the type of

column3: is  of  statutory  origin.  But  the

column2: assertion as usually made implies that stated cases were unknown
to the common law, which is decidedly wrong. …
